arts.ttl: Analysis: Five areas where Man City v Liverpool will be won and lost
arts.sum: They will want to press Man City, which means squeezing up, but Virgil van Dijk or Ibrahima Konate must not be dragged towards the ball like AFC Bournemouth ’s Marcos Senesi was last weekend (below) when Haaland was allowed to run clean through from his own half and score the opening goal. Liverpool left-back Andrew Robertson must also try to tuck in alongside Van Dijk when City attack, and the same applies to right-back Conor Bradley and Konate on the other side.
